title: 112_s681
content:
The Act titled "Greater Accountability in the Lending Fund Act of 2011" establishes a repayment deadline for the Small Business Lending Fund Program. The Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 is amended to remove certain clauses and specify the effective date and applicability of the amendments. The amendments made to the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 remove certain clauses and specify the effective date and applicability of the amendments to investments made under the Small Business Lending Fund Program. Investments made before the enactment of the Act will remain in full force and effect. The Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 is amended to include a sunset provision for the Small Business Lending Fund Program. After 15 years from the enactment of the Act, the Federal Government cannot maintain any capital investment in eligible institutions under the program. All authorities provided under the program will terminate after 15 years. SEC. 4. SMALL BUSINESS LENDING FUND TRIGGER: The Secretary cannot make any purchases under the Program if the FDIC is appointed receiver of 5% or more of eligible institutions.

SEC. 5. SMALL BUSINESS LENDING FUND LIMITATION. The Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 is amended to prohibit institutions that received investments under certain programs from participating in the Program. The Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 is amended to restrict institutions that received investments under certain programs from participating in the Small Business Lending Fund Program. The amendments take effect on the date of enactment of the Act and apply to investments made by the Treasury Secretary after that date. Investments made before the Act's enactment remain valid. The Act will remain in full force and effect under the terms and conditions of the investment. SEC. 6. Private investments under the Small Business Lending Fund Program are amended. SEC. 7. Approval of regulators. Section 4103(d)(2) of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 is amended to require approval of purchases under the subtitle by the Secretary based on the financial condition of the eligible institution. Views received from others are no longer required to be considered. Section 4103(d)(2) of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 is amended to require approval of purchases by the Secretary based on the financial condition of the eligible institution, removing the need to consider views from others. Amendments are made to ensure that the eligible institution should receive capital investment based on its financial condition. Amendments are made to Section 4103(d)(2) of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010, removing the requirement for consultation and approval based on the financial condition of the eligible institution. SEC. 8 of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 is amended to change the benchmark for small business lending to "during calendar year 2007".
